attributes.action: The Truth Regards The Iraq war
attributes.additional_details:
Three years since the last witness gave evidence to the Chilcot inquiry the inquiry report remains unpublished.Mr.Blair-supported by Cabinet Secretary Sir Jeremy Heywood the civil servant who was Blair’s principle secretary from 1999 to 2003 when decisions to go to war were being taken,are blocking their disclosure.These phone records hold a significant importance to Chilcot’s conclusions.
A majority of the British public believe that Mr.Blair along with, Alastair Campbell, exaggerated evidence that Saddam Hussein posed a deadly threat to Britian, These actions we believe were to trick the Cabinet,Parliament and the British Public into backing an invasion Mr.Blair had already agreed with the US President Mr.Bush.Therefore Mr.Cameron, we demand that through your office and with the backing of Parliament you will finally allow the truth about the Iraq war to be known.
